decks.notes: The main concept of this Merfolk deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing the tribal synergy of Merfolk creatures. By quickly establishing a board presence with lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis, as well as disruptive creatures like Merrow Reejerey and Cursecatcher, the deck aims to deal consistent damage and control the game with cards like Spreading Seas and Kira, Great Glass-Spinner. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Dismember and Vapor Snag provide removal and disruption options.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap artifact creatures and powerful equipment such as Cranial Plating. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer to boost the power of your creatures, along with the ability to quickly pump out mana with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, this deck aims to create an aggressive and efficient board presence. Additionally, cards like Etched Champion provide protection against removal spells, allowing for a consistent and aggressive strategy to take down opponents in a fast-paced manner.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Eldrazi Temple and Noble Hierarch to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes disruption with cards like Spellskite and Eldrazi Displacer, along with removal spells like Path to Exile. With a mix of aggressive threats and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents in the early game and maintain pressure throughout the match.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to control the board while deploying powerful threats such as Tarmogoyf and Liliana of the Veil. The mana base is designed to support a variety of color requirements for the spells in the deck, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Additionally, hand disruption in the form of cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for the deck to apply pressure and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on deploying artifacts quickly to take advantage of the affinity mechanic, in which the cost of artifacts is reduced based on the number of artifacts in play. This enables the deck to swarm the board with cheap creatures such as Ornithopter and Signal Pest, while utilizing powerful artifact synergies like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager to deal a large amount of damage quickly. Steel Overseer provides additional power and toughness boosts to the team, making it difficult for opponents to deal with the aggressive assault.

The deck focuses on utilizing various creatures to combo off and assemble a powerful board state. It leverages cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to search for key combo pieces like Melira, Sylvok Outcast, Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit, and Murderous Redcap. It uses cards like Viscera Seer, Kitchen Finks, and Eternal Witness to create value and resilient board presence. The deck also includes utility creatures like Orzhov Pontiff and Fiend Hunter, along with mana ramp engines like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to accelerate its game plan.

The focus of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain control of the game through efficient removal, countermagic, and card advantage. It utilizes Snapcaster Mage to recur powerful spells, Tasigur, the Golden Fang for card advantage and a threat, and a variety of removal and counterspells to control the board. The deck aims to grind out the opponent by leveraging its powerful spells such as Cryptic Command and Kolaghan's Command, while also having access to card draw with Ancestral Vision and Serum Visions. The land base is designed to support all three colors of the deck while providing utility lands like Creeping Tar Pit.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine, and Urza's Tower) in order to generate a large amount of mana. This allows the player to cast powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and other creatures like Spellskite, Wurmcoil Engine, World Breaker, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Ancient Stirrings, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to help find and assemble the Tron lands quickly. Control elements are also present with Lightning Bolt and Oblivion Stone to handle opposing threats.

The deck relies on quickly deploying a swarm of artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to pump them up and deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with the synergy between artifacts, sacrificing them to Arcbound Ravager for additional value and utilizing cards like Galvanic Blast for direct damage. The deck's aggressive playstyle seeks to quickly finish off the opponent before they have a chance to set up their own game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that work together to create powerful combos and synergies. By using cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, the player can quickly find and put into play specific creatures like Kitchen Finks, Melira, and Anafenza to gain incremental advantages and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of creatures like Viscera Seer and Murderous Redcap allows for infinite damage loops, while cards like Fiend Hunter and Qasali Pridemage provide flexibility and answers to various threats. The deck aims to control the board while setting up lethal combos to win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up and protect an infect creature such as Blighted Agent or Glistener Elf, while using pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa to increase their power and infect damage. Gitaxian Probe and Twisted Image can help draw cards and disrupt the opponent's plans, while cards like Apostle's Blessing and Vines of Vastwood provide protection and evasion. The ultimate goal is to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on the opponent through the use of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining aggressive threats like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze with disruption like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of cards like Abrupt Decay and Terminate provide additional versatility in dealing with a variety of threats, while cards like Kolaghan's Command offer additional value and flexibility.

This aggro Merfolk deck focuses on creating a powerful board presence with lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, boosting all Merfolk creatures on the battlefield. It uses disruptive elements like Harbinger of the Tides and Phantasmal Image to control the opponent's board while steadily increasing its own. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while cards like Spreading Seas and Sea's Claim disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of evasive Merfolk creatures backed up by powerful tribal synergies.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder while controlling the board using counterspells like Remand and Cryptic Command. The main win condition is to cast Scapeshift and sacrifice lands to fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and multiple Mountains to deal a lethal amount of damage to the opponent. Bring to Light helps find key pieces of the combo, while Snapcaster Mage offers versatility. Overall, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan while setting up for a game-winning Scapeshift combo.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using counterspells and removal while maintaining card advantage with cards like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage. Nahiri, the Harbinger is used as a win condition by tutoring for Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix for both removal and reaching the opponent's life total. With a solid mana base and powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, the Moon Sage, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponent in a slower-paced game.

The deck focuses on generating a large number of tokens quickly to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It includes cards that create token creatures such as Spectral Procession, Lingering Souls, and Raise the Alarm, as well as supporting cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar. The deck also includes mana ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to accelerate its token production. The lands in the deck are chosen to provide mana fixing and support for the token strategy, with cards like Gavony Township and Windbrisk Heights to further boost the power of the tokens.
